channel.title: REST: Practical Fundamentals :: C# Web Development
channel.description: Here’s a takeaway of the abstract ideas we covered on the last page: State: data that can change (transition) through interactions between an API and its client Representation: the convertible format that enables state to be transferred and used by the client and API Resource: the representation of a type of state (as an entity or collection) that the API exposes to its client for interaction Now that you have an understanding of these concepts, let’s turn our attention to the practical details of working with REST APIs.
